definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)

sentences.english: Will governments in the region maintain and even increase state ownership of financial institutions?
sentences.chinese: 這些地區的政府會保持甚至增容其國有金融機構嗎？

sentences.english: This research provides guidelines for financial institutions to choose future mergers and acquisitions targets.
sentences.chinese: 本研究亦可作爲未來金融機構選擇購併對象時之參考。

sentences.english: The competition of non-banking financial institutions started a drive toward innovation of the tools of the banking industry.
sentences.chinese: 非銀行金融機構的競爭始於銀行業工具創新的驅動。

sentences.english: I. You are approved to launch the inter-bank entrusted loans business with financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 同意你行開辦金融機構同業委託貸款業務。

sentences.english: The earthquake-hit regions will be exempt from the hike, the central bank said.
sentences.chinese: 央行還表示地震重災區法人金融機構暫不漲價。

sentences.english: Sooner or later the US Treasury and the Fed had to draw the line and the financial sector will eventually be healthier as a result.
sentences.chinese: 美聯儲和財政部遲早會出手，最終金融機構也會康復。

sentences.english: The undercapitalization of large financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 大型金融機構資本不足。

sentences.english: When you're a financial institution you can't fool around.It's all about confidence.
sentences.chinese: 一家金融機構不能糊弄人，這是事關信心的問題。

sentences.english: Shortly thereafter, financial institutions hit the skids in rapid succession.
sentences.chinese: 此後不久，金融機構接二連三地出現觸礁。

sentences.english: Interest expense incurred as a result of borrowing from financial institutions or other persons.
sentences.chinese: 凡向金融機構或他人借款等所發生之利息費用皆屬之。

sentences.english: The balance will be sought from governments and other International Financial Institutions.
sentences.chinese: 餘款將從各國政府和其他國際金融機構籌集。

sentences.english: Firstintroduce the development and reform of development finance in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 對日本的開發性金融機構的發展改革進行介紹。

sentences.english: We believe that this crisis was not only about the problems of some financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信，這場危機並非僅僅由金融機構的問題引發。

sentences.english: Executives are rotated between institutions by government decree.
sentences.chinese: 執行高管通常由政府任命在不同金融機構輪調。

sentences.english: A Anyang financial institutions responsible person plaints say.
sentences.chinese: 安陽一家金融機構負責人感嘆說。

sentences.english: We will continue the reform of policy-based financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 繼續推動政策性金融機構改革。

definition: to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
